intro: Anthistiria reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed anthistiria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The leaves are typically pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give the plant a delicate appearance. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
